titleInfo.title: Eine Zeitdiagnose vor 50 Jahren: Alfred Müller-Armack

mods.abstract: 'The author outlines and discusses Müller-Armack's diagnosis of our time (1949). The outline deals with its methodology, with an assessment of 19th century 'positions of mentality', and with an analysis of present positions as of the present social, political, and economic situation. The critical discussion places Müller-Armack's analysis in the tradition of the German 'mandarins' and in the context of German 'historical sociology'. 50 years thereafter, an evaluation of the cultural, political, and economic developments cannot but state that the options outlined by Müller-Armack to restructure German society after World War II have only temporarily and partially been effectuated.' (author's abstract)|
